description: I like to think about Bayesian inference as holding efficient beliefs, phrasing the task of inference as minimizing an objective defined in the space of all possible beliefs.

title: Inference and Prediction
description: There is a difference between the scientific pursuit of inference, trying to figure out what the real answer is, and prediction, trying to figure out what will come.

title: A Simple Demonstrations of Benford's Law
description: Benford's law is a natural consequence of scale invariance, this is relatively easy to see in the face of a circular sliderule.
